TAXONOMIC AND NOMENCLATURAL MATTERS 21
SUMMARY
21
INTRODUCTION
The International Centres aided by the World Health Organization for studies on enteric bacteria are concerned with the Salmonella, the Escherichia and the Shigella groups of micro-organisms. The salmonellae include not only the causative agents of the typhoid and paratyphoid fevers, but also some of the most important causative agents of food poisoning. The escherichiae include types which are responsible for severe forms of infantile diarrhoea, and the shigellae include those that are responsible for bacillary dysentery.
46
(2) 24h Acadena Historica

INTRODUCTION

The International Centres aided by the World Health Organization for studies on enteric bacteria are concerned with the Salmonella, the Escherichia and the Shigella groups of micro-organisms. The salmonellae include not only the causative agents of the typhoid and paratyphoid fevers, but also some of the most important causative agents of food poisoning. The escherichiae include types which are responsible for severe forms of infantile diarrhoea, and the shigellae include those that are responsible for bacillary dysentery.
